title: Antonio Conte hails invaluable John Terry and insists Chelsea skipper will NOT be leaving Stamford Bridge

Antonio Conte has insisted John Terry leadership remains vital to his - and Chelsea’s title bid. 
The Blues captain, 35, wants to stay and fight for his place at Stamford Bridge despite making just five Premier League appearances this season. 
Conte believes his experience will be key as Chelsea , who travel to Leicester on Saturday, bid to remain clear of the chasing pack for the remainder of the season. 
He said: “He is an important player for this team, for this squad and for me. 
“His work on the pitch, his work in the changing room outside is fantastic. Terry has found his opportunities limited this term (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur FC/Getty Images) The Chelsea skipper is sent off last week (Photo: PA Wire) 
“This showed he's a great player, but also a great man and for me it's fantastic to have a person as him to help me in my first season in Chelsea. 
“For this reason, I repeat, John stays with us, is our player, is in my squad. And when I see the situation and I want and he deserves to play, he'll play. He remains a really important player for me.” 
Conte has also warned his players not to take struggling Leicester for granted despite the Champions sitting 15th, just three places and six points off the bottom. 
Chelsea’s 13-match winning streak was ended by Spurs last week and although his men remain five points clear of second-placed Liverpool, Conte has reminded them to regain retain their focus. Conte with his Manager of the Month award (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Conte during his press conference (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
He added: Sometimes, if you don't pay the right attention, you can find your team in the middle or in the bottom of the league. 
“In this league every game you can win, but you can lose. It's not easy. I think Leicester game is very important. It's important for us to restart, to restart to win. 
“This game can be very tough, because Leicester are the champions of last season. They have a lot of good players, with good quality Read More Conte MATCHES one of Mourinho's Chelsea records in just three months 
“They impress me. For this reason it's important to play great attention.
